== Introduction ==

We are preparing Kubuntu Plucky Puffin (25.04) for release in  <nowiki>[[https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/plucky-puffin-release-schedule/36460 | April, 2025]]</nowiki>. With this '''Beta''' pre-release, you can see what we are testing in preparation for our next version.

'''NOTE:''' 

This is Beta Release. 
Kubuntu '''Beta Releases''' are '''NOT''' recommended for:
* Regular users who are not aware of pre-release issues
* Anyone who needs a stable system
* Anyone uncomfortable running a possibly frequently broken system
* Anyone in a production environment with data or workflows that need to be reliable

Kubuntu Beta Releases are recommended for:
* Regular users who want to help us test by finding, reporting, and/or fixing bugs
* Kubuntu, KDE, and Qt developers

Please '''report your installation results''' on the <nowiki>[[http://iso.qa.ubuntu.com/qatracker|Release tracker]]</nowiki>.

General bug reporting guidelines can be found here: ReportingBugs and <nowiki>[[https://invent.kde.org/teams/distribution-kubuntu/docs/-/wikis/Bug-Triage-Story|KubuntuBugTriage]]</nowiki>.

== Getting Kubuntu 25.04 Beta ==

=== Upgrading from 24.10 ===

To upgrade to a Kubuntu 25.04 pre-release version, run '''sudo do-release-upgrade -d''' from a command line.

=== Download a Disk Image ===

Download a <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/releases/25.04/beta/|Bootable image]]</nowiki>. Direct downloads, torrents, and zysnc are available as options.

== New features and changes in 25.04 Beta ==

A detailed description of the changes in the Ubuntu base can be found in the main <nowiki>[[https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/plucky-puffin-release-notes/48687/|Plucky Puffin release notes]]</nowiki>.

=== Kubuntu core desktop and applications ===

==== Plasma 6.3: ====

<nowiki>[[File:PlasmaPP.png||width=800]]</nowiki>

The Kubuntu team have been working hard to ship 25.04 with the latest Qt6 based Plasma 6.3 KDE desktop.

Included is <nowiki>[[https://kde.org/announcements/plasma/6/6.3.0/|Plasma 6.3]]</nowiki> which is the fourth feature release of the 6 series.

More details of what was new with Plasma 6 can be found in the <nowiki>[[ https:--kde.org-announcements-megarelease-6- |original announcement]]</nowiki> for the first 6.0 release.

==== Plasma Wayland session ====

The Plasma Wayland session is now the default option in SDDM (display manager login screen). An X11 session can be selected instead if desired. The last used session type will be remembered, so you do not have to switch type on each login.

==== Qt and KDE Frameworks ====

Kubuntu 25.04 Beta ships with Qt6.8 and KDE Frameworks version 6.12.0.

For applications that are still based on Qt5/KF5, Qt5 5.15.15 and Frameworks 5.116.0 are still in the archive.

==== KDE Applications updates ====

<nowiki>[[File:AppsPP.png||width=800]]</nowiki>

All KDE gear currently packaged by Ubuntu or Debian are now at least at the latest 24.12.3.

==== Web browser and office suite ====

* <nowiki>[[https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/136.0/releasenotes//|Firefox 136]]</nowiki> snap is the default browser from the <nowiki>[[https://snapcraft.io/firefox|Snap Store]]</nowiki>.
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.documentfoundation.org/ReleaseNotes/25.2|LibreOffice 25.2]]</nowiki> is provided by default in the full installation.

==== Kernel ====

Kubuntu 25.04 ships with the 6.14 Linux kernel.

== Feedback ==

Development of Kubuntu 25.04, Plucky Puffin Oriole, is ongoing and bugs are fixed every day.  Before reporting bugs, please ensure your system is up to date.  For verifying installation related bugs, updated disk images are available from <nowiki>[[http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/daily-live/current/|Daily bootable images for standard PCs and laptops]]</nowiki>.

You can give us feedback on <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/kubuntu.org|Facebook]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/kubuntu.org|<nowiki>[[File:Kubuntu-FB.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]] or <nowiki>[[https://twitter.com/kubuntu|Twitter]]</nowiki><nowiki>[[https://twitter.com/kubuntu|<nowiki>[[File:Kubuntu-Twitter.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]].
